Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Mature Animal Style, Grand or Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black (partly worn) with single band in added white above lotus bud in white outline with added red centre; exterior: slip mostly worn.
Curator's comments: The exterior surface provides no information about the style of the chalice. The interior decoration indicates that it is later than the Wild Goat Style. Lotus buds are found on Chian chalices through to the mid-6th century BC.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0691) (phase 2)
